text: Bas-Uele (French for "Lower Uele") is one of the 26 provinces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Its capital is Buta. Its name is from the Uele River. Before 2015, Bas-Uele was part of Orientale Province. The province includes the following territories: *Aketi *Ango *Bambesa *Bondo *Buta *Poko ==References== Category:Provinces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo Category:2015 establishments in Africa
title: Bas-Uélé
